div.div: Transforms different subtitles formats into a consistent list of subtitles (TimedText)

switch.text: Transforms different subtitles formats into a co...

div.div: State of subtitles. Has a device turned them on or a user?

div.div: Facade for Renderer and a container for the DOM and associated CSS helper functions. Potentially deprecated. If we remove this, setTransportControlPosition goes away.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 182px; height: 1px; padding-top: 10px; margin-left: 595px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 550px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: - Remove captions container from player component. Bigscreen-player can instantiate subtitles. Have subtitles be a passthrough to captions container for now.
- Remove Captions Container. setTransportControlPosition can go away.
- Remove toStyleFunction being injected into TimedText. Give it a style from construction.
- Stop TimedText from putting itself onto a parent element. Renderer can add to the DOM.
- Expose a node property that is the styled html element on the TimedText. This can be generated at construction. The original xml node reference can be removed after this too.

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
